PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

NOTE: Please print all proper names and place names in capital letters. If you are not sure the name is correct as you have given it, please say so. It is quite acceptable to have someone else do the writing at your dictation.

2. Your address: Bellevue, Sask., Canada.
3. Date: March 31/12.
4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country): MONTREAL, CANADA.
5. What was your father's name and occupation? FRANK X, BELLEFEUR.
6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year): Aug. 1906.
7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible: New York City, 1901; North Dakota, 1902-1903; North Dakota, 1904-1905; North Dakota, 1906.
8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use "I was a small child," "I was in my teens," etc.)
9. What were your reasons for coming West?
10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroad or government information?)

Dear Mr. Bellinger,

I am writing to you in response to your letter dated May 15th. I am pleased to hear from you and to know that you are doing well. I hope this message finds you in good health and spirits.

Yours sincerely,

J. F. Bellinger
I am writing this letter to you because I have been feeling unwell recently. My doctor has advised me to rest more and avoid stress. The good news is that I am recovering well and looking forward to returning to my normal routine soon.

Love,
J.F. Collins
